page.title: 04ABBEY FARM LOWER HEATH
page.content: At Abbey Farm Applebys make (with the help of others){Cheshire and Double {Gloucester cheese}from 300{Friesian cows.600 gallons of the 1000 gallons of milk is sent to the{cheese}room by pipe line to be made into cheese.There is a watery mixture called whey from the cheese which is sent through pipes into a big tank.It is then fed to the 400{pigs.}When the pigs weigh 200lbs they were sold for{pork and bacon.}The {cows}are milked twice a day,6-30am un- til 9-00am and 3-30pm until 6-00pm.The rotary parlour holds 20 cows at a ti- me.In the winter the cows are kept in sheds away from the bitter cold weath- er.They are fed on{barley and silage} in the winter and they have barley and grass from the fields in the Summer. Each cow has a number which is typed into a{computer}which gives them the right amount of corn in the parlour.
